segments.text: Look at that mess in the kitchen; water everywhere from the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The faucet's still running, and no one's doing a thing about it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's just polishing that plate, ignoring the flood at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's getting soaked, and she doesn't even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids are up to no good with that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy's on a stool that's tilting dangerously.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He's grabbing cookies like he owns the place.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's egging him on, reaching for one too.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This is going to end in tears or worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The cabinets are getting ruined by the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Outside, the garden's all nice and dry; why can't they keep it together inside?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone needs to yell and stop this nonsense right now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm fuming just watching this chaos unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR
